attributes.action: Article 50 should not be invoked until a General Election has been called.
attributes.additional_details: Article 50 should thus not be invoked until a General Election has been called. The main political parties must publish in their manifesto whether they will hold a second referendum and set up a cross party and expert members Panel to present a comprehensive and balanced analysis for the public to digest prior to a new referendum vote. All manifestos must include a clear exit strategy and explain to the public what we should expect as non member of the EU, and include single market in/exclusion
attributes.background: In view of the misleading and inaccurate information presented to the British public by the Exit lobby and failure of all political parties to fully explain the implications of leaving the EU to the people the Referendum of June 23rd of June 2016 should be declared unsafe.
